channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: ICYMI: Where OnePlus went wrong with its first smartwatch
item.description: This week's tech reviews include the Sony A1 camera, the ASUS Zephyrus G15 gaming laptop, the Positive Grid Spark Pearl and the OnePlus Watch.

item.title: SpaceX's reused Crew Dragon capsule docks with the ISS
item.description: Crew Dragon has docked with the International Space Station as part of the Crew-2 mission, marking the first time SpaceX has reused a crewed capsule.

item.title: Hitting the Books: How IBM's metadata research made US drones even deadlier
item.description: While the US military may have you in its sights, it might not know who you actually are — even as that wrathful finger of God is called down from upon on high

item.title: Learn to capture and edit great pictures in Luminar for $40
item.description: The award-winning Luminar 4 Power Bundle teaches you how to take well-composed pictures and has AI-powered software that can handle some of the grunt work

item.title: The Morning After: Picking the right mirrorless camera in 2021
item.description: All the new Apple hardware, drones making oxygen on Mars and more.

item.title: New space radar in Costa Rica can track even tiny orbital debris
item.description: There's a new giant space radar in Costa Rica that can track orbital debris as small as two centimeters.

item.title: Humble Bundle will test limiting charitable contributions to 15 percent
item.description: Starting in late May, Humble Bundle plans to test a new store page that will do away with its signature sliders.

item.title: The world's 'most powerful' tidal turbine is nearly ready to power on
item.description: Once it’s connected to the European Marine Energy Centre off the Orkney Islands, the two megawatt O2 will have the capacity to generate enough energy to power 2,000 UK households annually.

item.title: Senate hearing on algorithms will include Facebook, Twitter and YouTube execs
item.description: Early next week, executives from Facebook, Twitter and YouTube will participate in a Senate Judiciary hearing on algorithmic amplification.

item.title: ESPN+ will stream a Marvel-themed NBA game on May 3rd
item.description: Golden State Warriors and New Orleans Pelicans players will battle to become Marvel's first champion.

item.title: Oculus debuts its more customizable VR avatars
item.description: Oculus has rolled out brand new VR Avatars that are more customizable, right down to facial features.

item.title: Honda aims to shift car sales entirely to EVs by 2040
item.description: The automaker also revealed plans for an EV platform called e:Architecture.

item.title: Disney's latest robot will bring Groot and other characters to life
item.description: Project Kiwi could one day make Disney theme parks feel more real.

item.title: 'RuneScape' is heading to iOS and Android this summer
item.description: Not to be confused with 'Old School RuneScape,' which is already on mobile.

item.title: Volkswagen's ID.4 will race in the Mexican 1000 Rally
item.description: When the Mexican 1000 Rally kicks off on April 25th, Volkswagen's new ID.4 SUV will be one of the cars competing in the grueling 1,141-mile off-road race.

item.title: YouTube adds more video quality settings to its mobile apps
item.description: 'Data saver' and 'higher picture quality' modes have arrived.

item.title: This week's best deals: $100 off the Mac Mini M1 and more
item.description: This week's best tech deals include $100 off the Apple Mac Mini M1, $100 off the latest MacBook Air M1 and 20 percent off the Google WiFi system.

item.title: Valorant's new 'Breeze' map whisks you to the Bermuda Triangle
item.description: 'Valorant' Episode 2 Act 3 is launching on April 27 with a new map, skinline and battlepass.

item.title: This refurbished HP ProBook laptop is ready to use for under $200
item.description: With its tablet functionality, portable weight and slim design, this laptop is the ideal travel companion for work and school.

item.title: Spotify might counter Apple with its own podcast subscription service
item.description: Spotify may reportedly launch paid podcast subscriptions next week, offering an answer to Apple's just-launched feature.

item.title: Apple faces lawsuit over its iTunes 'buy' button
item.description: Apple is facing a putative class action lawsuit for allegedly misleading consumers by telling them they can 'buy' media on its iTunes store.

item.title: Apple's podcast subscriptions are good for business
item.description: Now that Apple has provided an easy way for podcasts to make money, will it spur a change in the industry?

item.title: Evercade's retro game cartridge system now has a home console
item.description: UK-based company Blaze Entertainment has launched Evercade VS, a follow-up to the Evercade handheld retrogaming console it released last year.

item.title: Yoto is a podcast and audiobook machine built for kids
item.description: Kids can enjoy audiobooks and podcasts too thanks to the child-friendly Yoto Player and its library.

item.title: Engadget Podcast: Apple’s AirTags and, yes, the purple iPhone
item.description: This week, Cherlynn and Devindra chat with Engadget’s Chris Velazco about Apple’s AirTags and the new purple iPhone. We dive into what it’s like to use the AirTags to find things, and their potential limitations.
